name: Mailing Test
subject: Test Mailing
html:
New from eLife
January 1, 1970
Recent articles Sign up for alerts About eLife For authors

Research article

A long non-coding RNA is required for targeting centromeric protein A to the human centromere
Delphine Quénet, Yamini Dalal
A non-coding RNA-based targeting mechanism could potentially epigenetically maintain specialized chromatin structures, such as the centromere, in vivo.
Full text | PDF | eLife digest | eLife Lens

Assembly principles of a unique cage formed by hexameric and decameric E. coli proteins
Hélène Malet, Kaiyin Liu, Majida El Bakkouri, Sze Wah Samuel Chan, Gregory Effantin, Maria Bacia, Walid A Houry, Irina Gutsche
Cryo-electron microscopy uncovers molecular determinants of a unique symmetry mismatched macromolecular cage in E. coli.
Full text | PDF | eLife digest | eLife Lens

A tethered delivery mechanism explains the catalytic action of a microtubule polymerase
Pelin Ayaz, Sarah Munyoki, Elisabeth A Geyer, Felipe-Andrés Piedra, Emily S Vu, Raquel Bromberg, Zbyszek Otwinowski, Nick V Grishin, Chad A Brautigam, Luke M Rice
Using linked TOG domains that each bind a curved conformation of αβ-tubulin, a microtubule polymerase catalyzes fast elongation by concentrating αβ-tubulin near the polymer end.
Full text | PDF | eLife digest | eLife Lens

The Drosophila F-box protein Fbxl7 binds to the protocadherin Fat and regulates Dachs localization and Hippo signaling
Justin A Bosch, Taryn M Sumabat, Yassi Hafezi, Brett J Pellock, Kevin D Gandhi, Iswar K Hariharan
The F-box protein Fbxl7 is a direct effector of the protocadherin Fat and functions in downstream pathways that regulate tissue shape and size.
Full text | PDF | eLife digest | eLife Lens

RNA-guided assembly of Rev-RRE nuclear export complexes
Yun Bai, Akshay Tambe, Kaihong Zhou, Jennifer A Doudna
Tertiary folding of the Rev-response element (RRE) in HIV RNA ensures the rapid formation of the Rev-RRE viral ribonucleoprotein particle via a two-step process.
Full text | PDF | eLife digest | eLife Lens

For the media

Your contact is Jennifer Mitchell: press@elifesciences.org, +44 (0)1223855373. Please cite eLife as the source of these articles and include a link to either the article or elifesciences.org. Thank you! More details available at http://elifesciences.org/for-the-press.

To be notified of new content at eLife, sign up at http://crm.elifesciences.org/crm/civicrm/profile/create?reset=1&gid=11.

eLife XML is available at Github.

Thanks for subscribing to receive alerts from eLife, the new journal for the very best in life science and biomedical research, supported by the Howard Hughes Medical Institute, the Max Planck Society, and the Wellcome Trust. If you have any questions or comments, feel free to contact us.
